CatDescriptText: Herman Smith, 2269 Somers Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "In the coming November elections, do you think voters should elect another Democratic Governor or change to a Republican?" answer reads: "I think that they should stay Democratic and vote in Mayor Lawrence. In my opinion he is doing so much in rehabilitating neighborhoods and other areas, tearing down buildings and slums.  I think he will continue the same as Governor.  He's a progressive man."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Herman Smith wearing hat and light colored shirt, standing on sidewalk in front of brick building and sunflowers
